trans-unit.source: Material attributes define the core characteristics of a material, such as its diffuse color, diffuse shading model, and so on. Attributes are organized into geometry, shading, and misc.
trans-unit.target: Material attributes define the core characteristics of a material, such as its diffuse color, diffuse shading model, and so on. Attributes are organized into geometry, shading, and misc.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of attribute:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of attribute:

trans-unit.source: attributes used as input values for a shading model (for example, the Diffuse attribute provides only color used by the diffuse shading model)
trans-unit.target: attributes used as input values for a shading model (for example, the Diffuse attribute provides only color used by the diffuse shading model)

trans-unit.source: attributes that can change the shading model (for example, diffuse shading models, such as the lambert model, interprets the diffuse attribute color)
trans-unit.target: attributes that can change the shading model (for example, diffuse shading models, such as the lambert model, interprets the diffuse attribute color)

trans-unit.source: Attributes contribute to a layer of a material. If a material is directly used as a model material, all its root attributes are considered part of the first layer.
trans-unit.target: Attributes contribute to a layer of a material. If a material is directly used as a model material, all its root attributes are considered part of the first layer.

trans-unit.source: You can also write custom shaders to use in material attributes.
trans-unit.target: You can also write custom shaders to use in material attributes.
